body_html: @DNXie @skyoung @mykalu I had the same problem, but then found that I had tensorflow-tensorboard 0.1.4 installed which depends on tensorflow. That seemed to be the source of the erroneous dependency, and updating it to 0.1.5 made it all work for me because tensorflow wasn't installed anymore.
body_text: @DNXie @skyoung @mykalu I had the same problem, but then found that I had tensorflow-tensorboard 0.1.4 installed which depends on tensorflow. That seemed to be the source of the erroneous dependency, and updating it to 0.1.5 made it all work for me because tensorflow wasn't installed anymore.
body: @DNXie @skyoung @mykalu I had the same problem, but then found that I had `tensorflow-tensorboard` 0.1.4 installed which depends on `tensorflow`. That seemed to be the source of the erroneous dependency, and updating it to 0.1.5 made it all work for me because `tensorflow` wasn't installed anymore.
